column4: I'm trying to enable ports 6500-6600 in ubuntu server, how do I go about this?
you have services running on those ports?
one of them in there...can't remember which one.
just gonna open a range for now until I track down which port
might as well open all of them actually, this server is behind another firewall
use netstat
what are you trying to accomplish?
I'm trying to get mythtv-backend to run
which machine is running which? and which one has the firewall?
it's running on my ubuntu 6.10 server edition box -- well trying to run -- and my linksys router has its firewall up
can you elaborate as to what you have in your network? hard to assist when am guessing what you got

I have a total of 6 computers in a star configuration around a linksys router. the computer I'm having issues with I just installed Ubuntu Server on and am trying to get mythtv-backend service to run. it runs as my user, as root, and when I do sudo -u mythtv mythbackend it runs, but when I run the script in init.d it gives me an authentication failed error. Ive tried anything I could think of, then I remembered on the ubuntu pag
e it said that ubuntu server has all ports diabled by default, so I thought ah-ha! that might be it...I just don't know what else to look for
I installed ubuntu server so this computer wouldn't be bogged down with a gui
you can isolate your server and just focused on getting connected to it from a client.
you have switches or hubs between your router and the client pc's?
switch
but I can't even get the service started, let alone think about connecting client pcs to it
are you logged on to your server?
I'm chatting with you on it.
try netstat -rn and it should show the ports you are using on your server
netstat only not netstat -rn
it shows me my ip routing table
I'm just going to restore to my previous distro until a later time when I can get things figured out better
